page.title: 09FARMING
page.content: We have been finding out about farming in our area. We found out that most farms have at least a hundred acres, but a few have two to three hundred acres. The smallest farms have sixty and five acres. The largest has three hundred and seventy acres. Most of the farmers work at least eighty hours a week in the summer, but one of the farmers a hundred hours a week. Except for the pig farm every farm keeps cows. Some only keep fifty cows, but most keep a hundred cows. Only two farms keep sheep. Elmore Farm has fifty eight sheep and Yew Tree Farm has 360 sheep. Hardwicke Farm has 20 pigs. The farmers get up at 4.30a.m. -7.00a.m. The main crop from farmers in our area is grass for silage, then barley, and thirdly wheat. Mr. Davidson own's a pig farm. The pig farm is in Elmore. It was built
